title: XRP ETF May Be on Cards as Grayscale Sponsors XRP Price Display Together With Bitcoin - The Crypto Basic
content:
The XRP Army has discovered an advertisement from Grayscale showcasing XRP alongside Bitcoin and Ethereum prices.

Chad Steingraber, a notable member of the XRP community and a professional game designer, brought attention to this development in a recent tweet.

Steingraber shared a capture of CNBC’s televised “crypto watch” featuring the prices of three prominent cryptocurrencies. In particular, the exhibition showcased the market values of Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and XRP.

- Advertisement -

Meanwhile, the display was a sponsored spotlight by the world’s largest cryptocurrency asset manager, Grayscale. Grayscale’s choice to sponsor a display of XRP prices alongside the leading cryptocurrencies reignited speculation that the prominent asset manager could pursue an XRP exchange-traded fund (ETF).

“Tell me with a straight face that Grayscale isn’t about to reboot their XRP ETF funds,” Steingraber remarked.

Tell me with a straight face that Grayscale isn’t about to reboot their #XRP ETF funds.. 😉 https://t.co/CdzxAGo1Vr pic.twitter.com/TqvnSu1WCV — Chad Steingraber (@ChadSteingraber) December 28, 2023

Why Grayscale XRP ETF is Likely

Remember that Grayscale previously included XRP in its XRP Trust and GDLC products. However, in 2021, Grayscale removed XRP from its Digital Large Cap fund, a move that followed the SEC’s assertion that XRP constituted an unregistered security.

- Advertisement -

Concurrently, Grayscale initiated the dissolution of its standalone XRP Trust in response to the SEC’s lawsuit. The firm explained that the legal action made it challenging for the Trust to convert XRP into dollars, particularly as several U.S.-based exchanges had delisted XRP.

However, the new ad showcasing XRP alongside BTC and ETH has passed a message of hope for the XRP Army. Note that Grayscale is currently pushing to convert its Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) to a spot ETF.

Besides, Grayscale is pursuing a similar quest to convert its Ethereum trust to an exchange-traded fund directly investing in ETH. The firm reportedly submitted a revised S-3 filing to the U.S. regulator when Barry Silbert, the CEO of its parent company, stepped down.

Ultimately, the recent advertisement featuring XRP’s price alongside BTC and ETH has led the XRP community to speculate that Grayscale might be contemplating a move to reintroduce support for XRP. Moreover, XRP now has a clear regulatory status in the United States.

title: Vitalik Buterin Unveils Ethereum's 2024 Roadmap with Emphasis on Consistency and Evolution - CryptoDaily
content:
Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin recently unveiled the Ethereum roadmap for 2024, revealing that the upcoming year would bring only minor alterations compared to the previous one.

In a series of informative posts shared on X (formerly Twitter), Buterin outlined the primary focal points for Ethereum in 2024, with the roadmap centered around six key components.

Furthermore, Buterin provided in-depth insights into these six elements—namely, the merge, the surge, the scourge, the verge, the purge, and the splurge—accompanied by a detailed chart featuring annotations and diagrams.

Despite the passage of time, Buterin pointed out that there were only minimal adjustments compared to the 2023 roadmap, emphasizing Ethereum’s evolving and crystallizing technical direction: “As Ethereum’s technical path forward continues to solidify, there are relatively few changes.”

Of paramount importance in this roadmap is “The Merge,” which seeks to maintain a straightforward and robust proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus.

The Merge event took place in September 2022, marking the integration of the Ethereum mainnet with the proof-of-stake blockchain known as the Beacon Chain.

READ MORE: Chinese Authorities Escalate Crackdown on Cryptocurrency

This momentous transition led to a substantial reduction in Ethereum’s overall energy consumption as it shifted away from the energy-intensive proof-of-work (PoW) consensus mechanism.

In a press release, Buterin also highlighted the progress made in Ethereum’s single slot finality (SSF), an integral aspect of the post-Merge PoS improvement.

SSF plays a pivotal role in ensuring that alterations to a blockchain block become irreversible without the burning of at least 33% of the total staked ETH.

He stated, “The role of single slot finality (SSF) in post-Merge PoS improvement is solidifying.

It’s becoming clear that SSF is the easiest path to resolving a lot of the Ethereum PoS design’s current weaknesses.”

In addition to the technical aspects, Buterin’s recent endeavors have included a desire to revive the original ideals of the “cypherpunk” revolution within the blockchain space.

The term “cypherpunk” refers to individuals who employ encryption to safeguard their privacy when accessing computer networks, particularly in the face of government surveillance.

Buterin elucidated in a blog post that Ethereum’s initial vision revolved around being a “public decentralized shared hard drive,” capable of harnessing peer-to-peer messaging and decentralized file storage.

However, this vision waned in 2017 with the shift towards financialization on the Ethereum platform.

Nevertheless, Buterin acknowledged that concepts like rollups, zero-knowledge proofs, account abstraction, and second-generation privacy solutions have gained prominence and have the potential to align with the values associated with cypherpunk principles.

title: Top 7 Cryptocurrency Predictions for the Upcoming Bull Run - Analytics Insight
content:
Exploring the top 7 Cryptocurrency predictions for the upcoming Bull run in 2024

As the cryptocurrency landscape continues to evolve, investors and enthusiasts eagerly anticipate the potential resurgence of a bullish market. In this dynamic environment, several key trends and predictions emerge, shaping the outlook for various cryptocurrencies. From the enduring dominance of Bitcoin to the evolving landscape of decentralized finance (DeFi) and the anticipated growth of altcoins like Ethereum, the upcoming bull run holds promises and challenges for crypto enthusiasts. Join us as we delve into the top seven cryptocurrency predictions that are expected to define the trajectory of this exciting market. Explore insights into Bitcoin’s resilience, the transformative potential of Ethereum, and the broader implications for the crypto space as we navigate the intricacies of these digital assets in the context of the anticipated bull run

Bitcoin Dominance Will Persist:

The most popular cryptocurrency, Bitcoin (BTC), is probably going to continue to rule the market. Bitcoin’s sustained market dominance can be attributed to institutional interest, broad acceptance, and its status as a store of value.

Altcoins Will Surge:

Altcoins, or other cryptocurrencies, are predicted to see substantial gains even while Bitcoin continues to dominate. During the bull run, Ethereum (ETH), Binance Coin (BNB), and other well-known altcoins might do better in terms of percentage gains than Bitcoin.

DeFi Boom Continues:

The decentralized finance (DeFi) industry is expected to keep expanding. DeFi platforms are anticipated to gain more traction and draw in more users and investors because they provide a range of financial services without the need for conventional middlemen.

NFT Market Evolution:

Recent years have seen a huge increase in the popularity of non-fungible tokens, or NFTs. More integration of NFT into other industries, such as entertainment, gaming, and the arts, is expected to drive the market’s evolution. Throughout the boom, new applications for NFTs can surface.

Ethereum 2.0 Progress:

Ethereum 2.0’s switch to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism is a noteworthy advancement. The development of Ethereum 2.0 could have a favorable effect on the price of Ethereum and the mood of the market.

Increased Regulatory Scrutiny:

There will probably be more regulatory scrutiny as the Bitcoin sector expands. Clearer rules for cryptocurrencies may be implemented by governments and regulatory agencies, which would impact market behavior and encourage greater institutional participation.

Rise of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs):

Global central banks are investigating and creating virtual currencies. The broader cryptocurrency ecosystem may be impacted by the growing conversations and advancements surrounding digital currencies issued by central banks during the impending bull run.

The top seven cryptocurrency predictions for the upcoming bull run paint a dynamic picture of the market’s future. From the sustained dominance of Bitcoin to the anticipated surge in altcoins, the evolution of decentralized finance (DeFi), and the transformative impact of Ethereum 2.0, the crypto landscape is poised for exciting developments.

title: We Asked ChatGPT if Solana (SOL) Can Become the Biggest Altcoin in 2024 - CryptoDaily
content:
Table of Contents

TL;DR

Solana’s SOL token has shown impressive performance this year, with significant growth in price and market capitalization, making it one of the top digital currencies in the market.

Future growth potential for SOL hinges on factors like technology adoption, overcoming past network issues, regulatory developments, and potential strategic partnerships, which could enhance its market value and utility.

Despite its progress, SOL’s market cap is still behind major players like Ethereum, but it has surpassed them in certain metrics like trading volume and NFT sales volume in recent times.

Can Solana (SOL) Progress Even More Next Year?

Solana’s native token – SOL – has been a top performer this year, with its price reaching almost $125 earlier this week. The token has skyrocketed by over 1,000% since January 1, while its market capitalization briefly surpassed the $50 billion mark and is currently standing at around $48 billion (per CoinGecko’s data).

This uptrend has made SOL the fourth-largest digital currency in the entire market, outpacing Binance Coin (BNB) and Ripple (XRP).

In the following lines we will take a deeper dive and check whether the asset’s progress could continue next year with SOL becoming the biggest alternative coin in the realm.

According to ChatGPT, such a scenario is not out of the cards but hinges on on multiple elements. One major factor is the possible adoption of the asset’s technology and network. Solana is known for its low costs and fast transaction speed, which makes it a preferred ecosystem for decentralized applications.

The AI-powered chatbot also estimated that SOL’s future success depends on coping with some issues that have caused reputational damage to the blockchain protocol in the past. Recall that Solana has experienced numerous network outages in the last few years.

Regulatory development was also outlined as a vital factor. According to ChatGPT, the implementation of favorable rules in the crypto industry could have a positive impact on SOL.

Last but not least, the chatbot pointed out possible partnerships that the blockchain entity might strike up with prominent organizations. Such strategic collaborations could enhance SOL’s utility and adoption, potentially boosting its market value.

Despite its rapid recent progress, SOL’s market capitalization is still far from Ethereum’s (almost $270 billion) and the one of USDT ($91 billion), meaning it has a long way to go before being throned as the largest altcoin.

Solana has Already Surpassed Ethereum in These Metrics

It is worth noting that Solana has performed better than its rival for the top – Ethereum – in some aspects. According to DefiLlama, trading volume on Solana has surged above $1.3 billion in the past few days. For the most part of the month, Ethereum was lagging behind.

SOL Trading Volume, Source: DefiLlama

Solana has also performed quite well in the non-fungible token space, registering an NFT sales volume of over $88 million in the last week. Ethereum has fallen behind with approximately $74 million for the same period.

What is more, Solana flipped Ethereum in terms of search volumes on Google, which is a testament to the growing interest in the cryptocurrency.

title: Vitalik Buterin Reveals Ethereum’s Road Map For 2024 - Bitcoinist
content:
Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin has shared the crypto project’s roadmap for 2024. In a series of posts on X on December 30, Buterin spoke extensively on Ethereum’s gameplan for the new year, which he claims is quite similar to the plan for 2023, albeit with a few changes.

Ethereum Roadmap 2024

According to information revealed by Buterin, the main focus of Ethereum for 2024 centers around six key goals, namely the Merge, the Surge, the Scourge, the Verge, the Purge, and the Splurge.

The Ethereum Merge aims to create an ideal, simple, robust, and decentralized proof-of-stake (PoS) network.

The Merge occurred in September 2022 with the integration of the Ethereum mainnet with the Beacon Chain, thus marking the end of the proof-of-work consensus algorithm. Speaking on post-Merge improvements in 2024, Buterin claimed that the single-slot finality (SSF) mechanism presented the easiest method of eliminating the current restrictions of Ethereum’s PoS design.



By popular demand, an updated roadmap diagram for 2023! pic.twitter.com/oxo58A2KuG — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) December 30, 2023

In regards to the Surge, Buterin stated that there will be notable advancements in rollup scaling with significant developments both on EIP 4844 and within various rollups. Additionally, there will be a focus on long-term improvement in cross-rollup standards and interoperability, all of which will drive Ethereum toward achieving the goal of processing over 100,000 transactions per second.

The Ethereum co-founder also highlighted that the Scourge target has been re-oriented to tackling economic centralization in two key areas namely MEV and liquid staking/pooling. In addition, Buterin stated that there will be significant progress in achieving the Verge with the incoming introduction of verkle trees, which will contribute to the easy verification of blocks in the Ethereum network.

Buterin Faces Allegations From Former Ethereum Foundation Advisor

In other news, Buterin has been accused of “defrauding the world” by former Ethereum Foundation adviser Steven Nerayoff. This statement came in response to Buterin’s concerns about the perversion of the original vision of Web 3.

In a blog post on Dec 28, the Ethereum founder shared that the blockchain project was initially designed to function as a decentralized, shared hard drive. However, users have since diverted from the vision with a focus more on the financial applications of Ethereum.

Nerayoff countered Buterin’s claims, stating that the Ethereum’s co-founder, along with “his cabal,” are responsible for the perversion of the “Web 3 vision,” which they used to “defraud the world.” So far, there has been no response to these accusations.

At the time of writing, Ethereum trades at $2,285.41 with a 0.81 decline in the last day. Meanwhile, the token’s daily trading volume is down by 36.68% and valued at $6.84 billion.

ETH trading at $2,285.41 on the daily chart | Source: ETHUSDT chart on Tradingview.com

Featured image from Forbes, chart from Tradingview

title: The Year Of Ethereum: ETH Long-Term Holder Percentage Surpasses BTC - Bitcoinist
content:
The percentage of long-term ETH holders has skyrocketed this year to surpass Bitcoin for the second time ever. According to data from on-chain analytics platform IntoTheBlock, Ethereum has done pretty well in its percentage of long-term holders this year, with over 70% of investors currently holding on to their assets for more than a year, a new milestone for the blockchain.

ETH Long-Term Holders Now Top BTC

Ethereum’s price activity has largely underperformed this year when compared to Bitcoin. But this isn’t surprising, as Bitcoin has led the entire industry in bullish metrics and investor confidence this year. However, data from IntoTheBlock suggest more Ethereum investors are holding onto ETH for the long haul, hopefully with the belief that it will continue to rise substantially in value over time.

Long-term holders are investors who refuse to sell their crypto even during times of market volatility and price depreciation. They are particularly important in maintaining the overall health of any blockchain, as they help to provide stability and reduce price volatility.

History has shown Ethereum surpassing Bitcoin as regards this metric only once before. It’s important to note that the last time this happened, ETH would go on to lead in this metric over the subsequent months.

2023 Review! This year, the percent of long-term $ETH holders surpassed that of Bitcoin for the second time ever! pic.twitter.com/i6kDzAjzgM — IntoTheBlock (@intotheblock) December 30, 2023

On the other hand, In/Out of the Money metric by IntoTheBlock shows Bitcoin leading Ethereum in terms of profitability. At the time of writing, 82.25% of all BTC addresses are making money at the current price, compared to 76.10% of ETH addresses.

Bitcoin’s high profitability can be linked to a huge number of early Bitcoins assumed to be lost forever. As a result, the percentage of holders who bought at the current price metric puts Ethereum ahead of Bitcoin.

Total crypto market cap is currently at $1.6 trillion. Chart: TradingView.com

Around 63% of ETH addresses who bought around the current price of $1,948 and $2,641 are still in profit compared to BTC’s 52% of addresses that bought between $35,729 and $48,402.

What’s Next For Ethereum?

Ethereum is currently trading at $2,285 and is up by 91% this year. However, the asset’s price has largely underperformed in comparison to major altcoins like Solana and Cardano, who are currently up by 925% and 145% respectively this year.

Interestingly, this hasn’t stopped bullish predictions from coming in regarding Ethereum. One of these is a prediction from BitMex founder Arthur Hayes, who estimated an astounding $5,000 price for Ethereum. Crypto analyst Raoul Pau also looked at price history to predict ETH outperforming BTC becoming a key macro trend of 2024. The first step in achieving this would be to break above the $2,380 price level.

For all the ETH bears… in Feb 2021, BTC first hit $44,000 (where it is today) and ETH was at $1400 (now $2250), 9 months later ETH was up 245%, BTC was up 45%… I think ETH outperforming BTC will be a key macro trend of 2024 and our work at EXPAAM suggests it. 1/ pic.twitter.com/QGSZahhldg — Raoul Pal (@RaoulGMI) December 21, 2023

Featured image from Pexels

title: Exploring Top Ethereum Hard Forks Performance Since Their Inception - Cryptopolitan
content:
Ethereum‘s prominence in the blockchain realm is undisputed, marking a significant milestone in cryptocurrency’s evolution. Hard forks, instrumental in Ethereum’s development, have been key in maintaining its relevance. This exploration dives into the ten most influential Ethereum hard forks, spanning its inception to the epochal transition from Proof-of-Work (PoW) to Proof-of-Stake (PoS).

Beyond technical updates, these forks signify Ethereum’s commitment to mainstream adoption. Each catalyzes scalability, security, and efficiency, underlining Ethereum’s leadership in the world of blockchain technology.

Understanding Forks in Blockchain

Forks are a common occurrence in the world of blockchain, often serving as mechanisms for making changes to the blockchain’s code. These alterations can vary widely in scope, from minor corrections and incremental updates to radical changes in the blockchain’s underlying protocol. Forks can be both planned and unplanned, driven by disputes within the crypto community or the need for technical improvements. Among these, hard forks stand out as the most significant, resulting in an irreversible separation of the blockchain and the introduction of a new protocol that is entirely incompatible with the old one. Hard forks are frequently employed to create new cryptocurrencies and launch innovative blockchain projects.

Ethereum’s prominence in the crypto space

Ethereum, with its substantial market capitalization, holds a prominent position in the world of blockchain. It has become the preferred choice for various purposes, including token issuance, decentralized platform creation, and the trading of Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs). The Ethereum network witnesses daily transaction volumes worth billions of dollars, with an additional $28.4 billion locked within it through third-party products and services. Ethereum’s success can be attributed in part to its active and engaged cryptocurrency community, which consistently implements systematic changes to enhance the network’s capabilities.

Ethereum hard Forks and their significance

Ethereum, like many other blockchain networks, has experienced both soft and hard forks as part of its continuous development. To better understand Ethereum’s hard forks, it’s informative to reference notable hard forks in other blockchain networks, particularly Bitcoin.

Bitcoin, the pioneering blockchain network created by the enigmatic Satoshi Nakamoto, has also undergone several significant hard forks in its history. These include Bitcoin XT, Bitcoin Classic, Bitcoin Unlimited, Segregated Witness (SegWit), Bitcoin Cash, among others. What these forks share in common with Ethereum’s hard forks is their aim to implement protocol upgrades through network consensus.

Ethereum’s hard forks have been prompted by a variety of concerns and challenges. These encompass issues related to security, decentralization, transaction fees, scalability, and limitations associated with ETH 1.0. Notably, Ethereum is more than just a digital currency; it serves as a versatile platform for a wide range of decentralized applications and smart contracts. Consequently, Ethereum’s development roadmap has evolved to meet the diverse needs of its user base.

Ethereum’s developmental roadmap

Ethereum’s developmental roadmap consists of four main stages: Frontier, Homestead, Metropolis, and Serenity. Unlike many Proof-of-Work (PoW) networks primarily focused on cryptocurrency, Ethereum has had to adapt and expand its capabilities to accommodate a multitude of use cases and features. This roadmap serves as a guiding framework for Ethereum’s ongoing development and improvement, with each stage addressing specific challenges and opportunities.

Frontier Thawing

The Frontier Thawing hard fork, which came into effect on September 7, 2015, at block number 200,000, marked a crucial juncture in Ethereum’s early development. Its significance lies in multiple facets. First, it introduced the concept of the “difficulty bomb,” a mechanism designed to increase the mining process’s complexity gradually. This served as a vital step in Ethereum’s transition from the energy-intensive Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism to the more eco-friendly Proof-of-Stake (PoS). Furthermore, Frontier Thawing lifted the 5,000 gas limit per block, enhancing the network’s capacity to handle transactions efficiently. This hard fork was not just about theoretical changes; it introduced concrete improvements, bolstering Ethereum’s security and speed. In essence, it laid the foundation for Ethereum’s future growth and development.

Homestead

Homestead, executed on March 14, 2016, stands as Ethereum’s first meticulously planned hard fork. Its significance lies in its role as a milestone, marking Ethereum’s departure from the beta phase and its entry into a more mature stage of development. This hard fork was driven by Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) such as EIP-2, EIP-7, and EIP-8. These EIPs ushered in protocol improvements aimed at refining smart contract creation and development protocol forward compatibility. Homestead, in essence, paved the way for Ethereum’s growth by bolstering the network’s robustness. Its strategic implementation and adherence to the Ethereum Improvement Proposal process demonstrated Ethereum’s commitment to systematic upgrades and its continued journey towards mainstream adoption.

The DAO Fork

The DAO Fork, executed on July 20, 2016, marks one of the most pivotal moments in Ethereum’s history. Its significance transcends technical updates, as it emerged in response to a critical vulnerability – the DAO attack, resulting in the loss of 3.6 million ETH. Ethereum’s response was swift and impactful. The community voted to move the affected funds to a new contract, allowing original owners to withdraw their funds at a rate of 1 ETH for every 100 DAO tokens held. However, this solution led to a schism within the Ethereum community, giving rise to two separate blockchains – Ethereum (ETH) and Ethereum Classic (ETC). The DAO Fork, therefore, became a touchstone for Ethereum’s governance and direction, reflecting the community’s values and its commitment to security and integrity.

Byzantium

The Byzantium hard fork, integral to Ethereum’s Metropolis upgrade, represents a critical juncture in the platform’s development. This hard fork, executed on October 16, 2017, at block 4,370,000, brought forth significant enhancements. Key Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) introduced during Byzantium included EIP-100, which revamped the difficulty adjustment formula, resulting in a more consistent block time. EIP-197 and EIP-198 introduced ZK-Snarks, a form of zero-knowledge cryptography that bolstered privacy. EIP-649 delayed the difficulty bomb by one year and reduced mining rewards from 5 ETH to 3 ETH, mitigating inflation. Byzantium thus paved the way for future scaling solutions, curbed ETH inflation, and introduced functionalities that allowed the development of more complex smart contracts and decentralized applications (DApps) on the Ethereum network.

Constantinople

The Constantinople hard fork, implemented on February 28, 2019, at block 7,280,000, marked a significant stride in Ethereum’s journey towards Ethereum 2.0 while focusing on efficiency and economics. Notable EIPs included EIP-145, which introduced native bitwise shifting instructions to the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). EIP-1234 delayed the difficulty bomb for approximately 12 months and reduced block rewards from 3 ETH to 2 ETH. Constantinople’s role was paramount in optimizing Ethereum’s overall efficiency and economic sustainability, aligning it with Ethereum 2.0’s long-term scaling strategy. This fork was a crucial step in Ethereum’s evolution, preparing the network for the transition to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism.

Istanbul

Istanbul, activated on December 8, 2019, at block 9,069,000, was designed to enhance Ethereum’s compatibility with other protocols and improve its overall performance. It introduced several pivotal Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) that significantly impacted the network. EIP-152 facilitated interoperability between Ethereum and the Zcash blockchain. EIP-1108 reduced gas costs for privacy and scaling solutions like SNARKs and STARKs, enhancing scalability and privacy. EIP-1884 increased gas costs for certain EVM operations, fortifying the network against spam attacks. EIP-2028 further reduced gas costs, aiding in Layer 2 scaling solutions like Plasma. Istanbul, in essence, elevated Ethereum’s scalability, privacy, and resilience to denial-of-service attacks, streamlining the platform for developers and users alike.

Beacon Chain

The Beacon Chain hard fork, launched on December 1, 2020, marked a crucial milestone in Ethereum’s planned transition from Proof-of-Work (PoW) to Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus. The Beacon Chain introduced PoS to Ethereum’s ecosystem, revolutionizing its security and decentralization mechanisms. In PoS, validators lock up ETH as collateral to validate transactions and secure the network. This shift enhances security by discouraging malicious actors, as they risk losing their staked ETH. Moreover, it promotes decentralization by allowing more participants to become validators, reducing the influence of centralized mining pools. The Beacon Chain continues to play a vital role in Ethereum’s ecosystem, managing the PoS protocol while upholding the network’s state and transaction processing in a separate execution layer.

London Upgrade

The London upgrade, implemented in August 2021, introduced Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 1559, fundamentally altering the network’s transaction fee model. EIP-1559 introduced a new transaction fee structure that includes a base fee burned with each transaction, thereby reducing the supply of ETH over time. This innovation was a pivotal move toward economic sustainability for Ethereum. By curbing excessive gas fees and providing a predictable fee structure, EIP-1559 improved the user experience and made Ethereum more accessible for a broader range of participants. This upgrade was essential to ensure that Ethereum remains a viable platform for users and developers while addressing concerns about escalating transaction costs.

The Merge

The Merge, executed on September 15, 2022, stands as one of the most transformative moments in Ethereum’s history. It signifies the complete transition from the energy-intensive Proof-of-Work (PoW) to the environmentally friendly Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. This transition resulted in an astounding reduction of approximately 99.95% in energy consumption, effectively addressing one of the main criticisms of blockchain technology. Beyond its environmental benefits, The Merge has significant implications for scalability and security. The PoS mechanism enhances security by requiring validators to lock up ETH as collateral, and it lays the groundwork for Ethereum’s future scalability solutions, ensuring its sustainability and continued growth.

Shanghai-Capella

Technically executed on the same day, April 12, 2023, at block 17,034,870, Shanghai and Capella are pivotal hard forks that have a shared goal: to facilitate staking withdrawals. Shanghai introduced the capability for staking withdrawals on the execution layer, while Capella upgraded the Beacon Chain, enabling blocks to accept withdrawal operations. These forks play a crucial role in enhancing the liquidity, security, and decentralization of staked assets. By making staking more accessible and flexible, they encourage more users to become validators, further strengthening the Ethereum network. These upgrades are a testament to Ethereum’s commitment to optimizing its staking ecosystem and ensuring the security and liquidity of participants’ assets.

Conclusion

Ethereum’s journey through its ten most significant hard forks has been transformative. Each fork, from Frontier Thawing’s foundation-laying to The Merge’s monumental shift to Proof-of-Stake, has propelled Ethereum’s evolution. These upgrades brought scalability, security, and economic sustainability to the forefront, while recent innovations like the London upgrade with EIP-1559 and the Beacon Chain’s Proof-of-Stake transition have further enhanced Ethereum’s usability and sustainability. As Ethereum continues to evolve, with upcoming updates like Danksharding on the horizon, it remains a trailblazer in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space, driving innovation and setting the standard for a more sophisticated and capable decentralized network. Ethereum’s journey is testament to its pivotal role in shaping the future of decentralized technology.

title: How EIP-7514 Will Change Ethereum Staking - Cryptopolitan
content:
Ethereum, a pioneering blockchain platform, has seen a remarkable surge in staking activity. Staking, a crucial aspect of blockchain networks, involves participants locking up their cryptocurrency holdings to support and secure the network’s operations. In Ethereum’s case, this entails locking up Ether (ETH), the platform’s native cryptocurrency.

What’s truly noteworthy is the speed at which staking has grown within the Ethereum ecosystem. This rapid expansion reflects the community’s enthusiasm for participating in network validation and earning rewards. However, as Ethereum’s staking volume continues to skyrocket, concerns have arisen regarding potential challenges that could impact the network’s stability and incentives for stakers. So, let’s find out more about EIP-7514.

Understanding Ethereum Staking

Ethereum staking is a fundamental mechanism that underpins the security and functionality of the Ethereum network. It involves participants, known as validators, locking up a portion of their Ether (ETH) holdings as collateral to support various network operations. In return for their active involvement, validators are rewarded with additional ETH tokens. This process represents a significant departure from the traditional Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism and forms the cornerstone of Ethereum’s transition to Proof-of-Stake (PoS).

The importance of staking lies in its ability to enhance network security and scalability while reducing its environmental footprint. By staking their ETH, validators essentially vouch for the validity of transactions and the integrity of new blocks added to the blockchain. In doing so, they contribute to Ethereum’s decentralization, making it more resilient to attacks and censorship.

Validators are motivated to participate in staking by the promise of rewards. These rewards serve as incentives for validators to act honestly and fulfill their role in securing the network. The longer validators commit their ETH and actively participate, the greater their potential rewards. It encourages long-term engagement and fosters a sense of responsibility among validators.

In essence, Ethereum staking plays a pivotal role in the evolution of the network, offering both security and the opportunity for token holders to actively contribute to its operation while earning rewards for their efforts.

The Concerns with Rapid Staking Growth

The rapid and exponential growth of staking on the Ethereum network has raised concerns among developers and stakeholders. While staking was introduced to bolster network security and encourage active participation, its unforeseen surge has brought several challenges.

One significant issue stems from the strain imposed on the Ethereum network due to the substantial increase in validators. As more participants engage in staking, the number of validators and their corresponding responsibilities escalate. This results in a surge in network traffic, leading to congestion and slower transaction processing times. The strain on the consensus layer, responsible for confirming transactions, grows exponentially with the expansion of staking.

Moreover, as more ETH is staked, the rewards earned by validators are distributed among a larger pool of participants. This dilution of rewards means that individual validators may receive smaller payouts than when the staking pool was smaller. It could potentially discourage long-term staking and active participation in the network.

Perhaps the most alarming concern is the possibility that a substantial portion of Ethereum’s total Ether supply will be staked. According to projections, as much as 50% of all Ether could be staked by May 2024, with the potential to reach 100% by December 2024. While high staking levels theoretically increase network security, they also present the risk of depleting the available supply of Ether for regular transactions.

These challenges necessitate careful consideration and proactive measures to ensure the continued stability and functionality of the Ethereum network. Ethereum Improvement Proposal 7514 (EIP-7514) has emerged as a potential solution to address these concerns and strike a balance between fostering staking growth and maintaining network efficiency.

Introduction to EIP-7514

EIP-7514, short for Ethereum Improvement Proposal 7514, emerges as a pivotal solution in the Ethereum ecosystem, strategically designed to tackle a pressing issue: unprecedented staking growth. Within Ethereum’s continuous evolution, this proposal stands as a beacon of change, seeking to address the challenges that have arisen due to the rapid expansion of staking activities.

The need for EIP-7514 stems from the remarkable surge in Ethereum staking, which, while intended to fortify network security and incentivize active participation, has also introduced various unforeseen complications. These complications encompass network congestion, diluted rewards for validators, and the prospect of a substantial portion of Ether being staked, potentially affecting regular transactions.

EIP-7514 emerges as a proactive response to these challenges, aiming to strike a delicate balance between fostering the growth of staking, ensuring network efficiency, and preserving Ethereum’s long-term sustainability. In essence, it acts as a critical piece of the Ethereum puzzle, offering solutions to the burgeoning staking landscape while safeguarding the integrity of the network.

How EIP-7514 Works

EIP-7514, at its core, introduces a crucial change to the Ethereum network’s staking dynamics. At the heart of this proposal lies the concept of a lower churn limit, a pivotal element that serves to reshape the landscape of Ethereum staking.

As proposed by EIP-7514, the lower churn limit sets a maximum threshold on the number of validators that can be added to the network within a specified time frame. Unlike the previous model, where validator activations could grow exponentially, this new approach introduces a more linear and controlled growth pattern.

The primary objective of this lower churn limit is to curb the rapid rate of staking within the Ethereum ecosystem. By capping the number of new validators that can join the network at a given time, EIP-7514 seeks to slow down the staking influx. This deliberate reduction in the pace of staking activities serves a crucial purpose – it provides the Ethereum community with the time and space needed to explore and implement sustainable, long-term solutions.

In essence, EIP-7514 is not a final remedy but a strategic maneuver to buy time and deliberate on more permanent measures. By imposing restrictions on activating new validators, it aims to alleviate the pressure on the Ethereum network, ensuring smooth operations. At the same time, preparations are made to address the challenges posed by the exponential growth of staking.

Community Responses

Within the Ethereum community, EIP-7514 has sparked a spectrum of opinions and reactions, reflecting the diverse perspectives that contribute to the network’s development.

Advocates of EIP-7514 argue passionately in favor of its implementation. They stress the importance of research, analysis, and thoughtful decision-making in the face of Ethereum’s rapid growth. These proponents maintain that the lower churn limit proposed by EIP-7514 is necessary to prevent the network from being overwhelmed by staking activities. They view it as a prudent measure to buy time and space for the community to explore and implement sustainable solutions that can ensure Ethereum’s long-term stability.

Conversely, critics within the Ethereum community have expressed reservations about the proposal. Some believe that EIP-7514 was introduced hastily without sufficient deliberation. They argue that the urgency to cap validator growth doesn’t align with the steadily shrinking activation queue. These skeptics question whether the proposal’s rushed nature might compromise Ethereum’s commitment to network neutrality, a core principle that sets Ethereum apart in the competitive crypto landscape.

The discourse surrounding EIP-7514 is emblematic of Ethereum’s dynamic and collaborative governance model, where divergent viewpoints merge to shape the network’s future. It signifies a commitment to addressing challenges and ensuring Ethereum remains resilient and adaptable in a constantly evolving ecosystem.

Potential Impact on Ethereum Staking

The introduction of Ethereum Improvement Proposal 7514 (EIP-7514) represents a pivotal moment in Ethereum staking. This proposal, aimed at addressing the exponential growth in staking activities, has the potential to usher in significant changes with far-reaching implications.

Foremost, EIP-7514 seeks to slow down the rapid expansion of staking on the Ethereum network. The current trajectory suggests that an astonishing 50% of all Ether in circulation could be staked by May 2024 and a staggering 100% by December 2024. While this might seem like a show of community participation, it raises concerns about network stability and the sustainability of staking incentives.

One of the primary concerns is network strain. As more Ether is staked, the Ethereum network experiences increased activity, leading to congestion and potential bottlenecks in transaction processing. That could hinder the network’s efficiency and ability to handle the growing load of staking-related activities.

Moreover, the rapid staking growth could dilute staking rewards. As more participants stake their Ether, the rewards per staked Ether may decrease, potentially discouraging long-term staking commitments. It challenges Ethereum’s goal of creating a secure and robust staking ecosystem.

In the competitive crypto landscape, Ethereum has prided itself on its commitment to network neutrality and adaptability. EIP-7514, while a temporary measure to alleviate immediate concerns, may impact Ethereum’s standing. The rush to implement the proposal has sparked debates about the network’s governance and decision-making processes.

However, it’s essential to view EIP-7514 as the Ethereum community’s proactive step to manage the risks associated with rapid growth. This proposal buys valuable time for Ethereum developers and stakeholders to explore and implement long-term solutions to address the challenges of extensive staking while ensuring Ethereum remains a secure, efficient, and competitive blockchain platform.

As the Ethereum network continues to evolve and adapt, the potential impact of EIP-7514 on staking and Ethereum’s role in the crypto landscape remains a subject of intense discussion and scrutiny within the community.

Future Implications of EIP-7514

The Ethereum network has experienced significant volatility since its inception, and EIP-7514 could be likened to hitting the “pause” button. This proposal gives the Ethereum community the breathing room to deliberate and make more informed decisions about the network’s future. It represents a moment of reflection and consideration for the community to navigate the complexities and challenges that may arise in the blockchain space.

The discourse surrounding EIP-7514 highlights the dynamic nature of Ethereum’s governance and the community’s proactive approach to addressing emerging issues. Evaluating EIP-7514 requires careful consideration of its long-term implications, as it could potentially establish a precedent for dealing with unforeseen challenges.

Conclusion

Ethereum Improvement Proposal 7514 (EIP-7514) marks a significant development in Ethereum staking. The explosive growth of staking on the Ethereum network has presented opportunities and challenges, making it imperative for the community to take proactive measures.

EIP-7514 serves as a crucial intervention to slow the pace of staking, offering a respite from the looming possibility of 50% of Ether being staked by May 2024 and 100% by December 2024. This measured approach seeks to address concerns related to network strain and the potential dilution of staking rewards, preserving the long-term viability of Ethereum’s staking ecosystem.

Beyond its immediate impact, EIP-7514 highlights the dynamic nature of Ethereum’s governance and decision-making processes. It underscores the Ethereum community’s commitment to adaptability and willingness to address emerging challenges promptly. As Ethereum continues to evolve, its governance decisions have far-reaching implications for the broader crypto industry, setting the stage for future developments and innovations.

Ethereum’s journey exemplifies the industry’s resilience and capacity for evolution in a rapidly changing crypto landscape. EIP-7514 is not merely a proposal; it represents Ethereum’s ongoing commitment to secure, efficient, and competitive blockchain solutions, making it an exciting space to watch for all stakeholders and enthusiasts.

title: Tron's Justin Sun Pays Tribute To Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin - TronWeekly
content:
Tron Founder Justin Sun recently paid homage to Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, lauding his technological insights. In an extensive post on the X platform, Sun highlighted Buterin’s pivotal role in Ethereum’s early development and drew parallels between their journeys.

I have known @VitalikButerin for eight years now.

Vitalik is younger than me, but his insights far exceed mine. I have always been able to learn from Vitalik.

Although in the Crypto world, many people may see us as representatives of different values in the crypto world, as if we… — H.E. Justin Sun 孙宇晨 (@justinsuntron) December 29, 2023

Justin Sun disclosed that his acquaintance with Buterin traces back to 2015, during his initiation into Jack Ma’s Hupan University, marking his entry into the crypto realm. Engaging with Buterin during Ethereum’s nascent stage, Sun revealed purchasing a substantial amount of Ethereum, yet faced the challenge of needing an active wallet to house the acquired assets. Proposing the necessity of a decentralized wallet, Sun presented multiple prototypes to Buterin.

Despite diverging paths over nearly a decade, Justin Sun emphasized shared foundational principles with Buterin, particularly on decentralization. Stressing the importance of protocols functioning seamlessly even in the absence of their founders, Sun underscored their aligned ideologies.

Justin Sun’s Impact On Tron and Crypto Platforms

Justin Sun delved deeper into the importance of “auditability,” emphasizing the critical need for accessibility in verifying application logic. His advocacy extended to ensuring continuous full-node operation, a crucial element in guaranteeing compliance with the instructions outlined in open-source documentation. These foundational beliefs echo across fundamental blockchain concepts, embracing ideals such as open global participation and neutrality principles.

Renowned as a pivotal figure within the crypto landscape, Sun’s influence extends across multiple industry-leading applications. He holds sway over significant platforms like Tron Blockchain, the BitTorrent protocol, Poloniex Exchange, and Huobi Global. Sun’s transactional activities stand under the scrutiny of meticulous tracking by top-tier market analysts, underscoring his substantial impact and reach within the cryptocurrency realm.

Justin Sun has been criticized, particularly after the Poloniex exchange hack. Nevertheless, his steadfast conviction in the future of blockchain technology and his unwavering commitment to preserving the fundamental principles of decentralization remains steadfast.

Justin Sun’s tribute to Vitalik Buterin underscores their intertwined past and sheds light on their shared vision for blockchain’s future. As the industry evolves, their ideological alignment might continue to shape the trajectory of decentralized technologies.

title: Ethereum 2024: Focus on Scalability and Security Roadmap to 2024 - Crypto News Flash
content:
Vitalik Buterin presents Ethereum’s 2024 roadmap, focusing on scalability, security, and efficiency.

Innovations include The Meltdown, The Boom, The Purge, and more, seeking to robust Ethereum and enhance its cyberpunk ethos.

Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has unveiled Ethereum’s updated 2024 roadmap, which continues last year’s ambitious plans with some refinements and continued emphasis on certain key areas.

The roadmap focuses on six key components – The Merge (The Merge), The Surge (The Surge), The Scourge (The Scourge), The Verge (The Verge), The Purge (The Purge) and The Splurge (The Splurge) .

By popular demand, an updated roadmap diagram for 2023! pic.twitter.com/oxo58A2KuG — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) December 30, 2023

Each of these elements plays a crucial role in shaping the future of the Ethereum network, with the goal of making it more robust, scalable, efficient and aligned with its original cyberpunk ethos.

The Merge

This crucial component was already implemented in 2022 with the shift from a proof-of-work (PoW) to a proof-of-stake (PoS)consensus mechanism . The Merge marked a significant reduction in Ethereum’s energy consumption and laid the groundwork for future upgrades. Buterin emphasized the importance of maintaining a simple and resilient PoS consensus, stressing its importance for network stability and efficiency.

The Surge

The Surge seeks to significantly improve Ethereum’s scalability by implementing data fragmentation. Fragmentation involves splitting the blockchain into smaller segments, which can process transactions and store data more efficiently.

This upgrade is expected to increase network capacity and reduce transaction costs, contributing to Ethereum’s scalability goals, including achieving 100,000 transactions per second on Ethereum and its Layer 2 networks.

The Scourge

Addressing security concerns is a priority in The Scourge. It focuses on mitigating potential security vulnerabilities and improving the robustness of the network. This includes exploring new consensus mechanisms and improving the security of smart contracts, as well as addressing issues related to Miner Extractable Value (MEV) and liquidity pooling.

The Verge

This component seeks to simplify user experiences and improve developer tools. The goal is to simplify the Ethereum interface and improve the development process for decentralized apps (dApps) and other applications. Easier block verification is part of this update, making the network more accessible and easier to use.

The Purge

In the Purge, the focus is on cleaning up the Ethereum protocol by removing obsolete or unnecessary code. This streamlining aims to improve the overall efficiency of the network and reduce potential security risks associated with old or disused code. It is a process of continuous refinement to keep the network agile and efficient.

The Splurge

The Splurge is essentially an investment in the future of Ethereum. It includes research and development of emerging technologies and potential breakthroughs for the Ethereum network. This includes exploring zero-knowledge proofs (zero-knowledge proofs), rollups and other privacy-enhancing solutions. It is a commitment to innovation and staying at the forefront of blockchain technology.

In addition to these technical updates, Buterin also emphasized the need to revive Ethereum’s original cyberpunk vision. This vision includes a focus on decentralized applications, privacy protection and peer-to-peer communication.

The integration of technologies such as rollups and zero-knowledge proofs is seen as a step toward restoring this ethos and enabling the development of more private and censorship-resistant applications on Ethereum.

Finally, Buterin endorsed single-space finality (SSF) as the simplest way to address many of the current weaknesses in Ethereum’s PoS design. Advances made in Layer 2 networks and Verkle tree implementations were also praised, indicating a healthy development trajectory for the network.

The Ethereum 2024 roadmap, as outlined by Buterin, indicates a continued commitment to improving the scalability, efficiency, security and usability of the network. It also reflects a desire to return to the network’s original principles of decentralization and privacy, ensuring Ethereum’s relevance and utility in the evolving digital landscape.

.

title: Ethereum L2 activity: Impact on Arbitrum (ARB) and Optimism (OP) - Crypto News Flash
content:
Activity in Ethereum L2 increases markedly in 2023, with transactions in Arbitrum and Optimism growing significantly, driving their prices upwards.

Technical analysis reveals fluctuations in ARB and OP, with upside reversal potential for ARB and volatility forecast for OP.

The year 2023 has witnessed a significant change in the Ethereum ecosystem, with a notable increase in activity in its Layer Two (L2) protocols. According to IntoTheBlock, a blockchain intelligence firm, transactions on L2s increased 90 times compared to 2021. This change is due to the adoption of scalability solutions such as Arbitrum (ARB) and Optimism (OP), which has had a noticeable impact on both their usage and the value of their native tokens.

Troubleshooting Scalability Issues in Ethereum

Ethereum’s L2s were developed to solve scalability issues faced by users on the main chain, which processes approximately 15 transactions per second and carries high gas rates. Optimistic rollups, including Arbitrum and Optimism, allow users to process transactions with increased speed and at reduced costs.

In 2023, activity on Ethereum has increasingly moved to L2s, with L2 transactions increasing by 90x compared to 2021 pic.twitter.com/FhWJ1WG2ju — IntoTheBlock (@intotheblock) December 30, 2023

ARB and OP Price Impact

The price of ARB has risen 54% in the last 90 days, while OP has enjoyed a 170% increase over the same period. These returns have led to ARB and OP being considered tokens to watch in 2024.

Technical Analysis of Arbitrum (ARB)

Despite reaching a high of $1.64 on Dec. 28, ARB faced rejection and its price fell to $1.44. Technical analysis suggests possible additional selling pressure.

The Aroon indicator signals a bearish trend, with a chance of losing support at $1.40. However, there is support at $1.29 that could lead to a short-term bounce. The Money Flow Index (MFI) indicates that ARB is oversold, which could precede a reversal to the upside.

Optimism Technical Analysis (OP)

OP’s market structure is similar to that of ARB. It is currently trading at $3.63, with Bollinger Bands (BB) indicating high volatility. This suggests significant fluctuations in price. If selling pressure increases, OP could fall to $3.34, but an increase in buying pressure could take it towards $4.

The Relative Strength Index (RSI) shows that buyers don’t have much control, which could result in a drop below $3.63 if the bulls don’t intervene.

Changes for Ethereum L2 and Its Tokens

Increasing activity on Ethereum’s L2s, especially Arbitrum and Optimism, shows a significant shift in user preference and a potential positive impact on the value of its tokens. As Ethereum continues to scale and offer more efficient solutions, ARB and OP are shaping up to be key assets in the cryptocurrency landscape. However, investors and users need to keep an eye on market trends and technical analysis to trade in this sector.

title: Ethereum's 2024 Roadmap Revealed: Vitalik Buterin Outlines Key Focus Areas - TronWeekly
content:
In a recent development, Vitalik Buterin, the pioneering mind behind Ethereum, has revealed the much-awaited Ethereum roadmap for 2024, indicating a limited divergence from the preceding year. In a recent X post, Buterin emphasized the primary focal points shaping Ethereum’s direction in 2024, detailing six critical components.

By popular demand, an updated roadmap diagram for 2023! pic.twitter.com/oxo58A2KuG — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) December 30, 2023

In an exhaustive breakdown, meticulously presented through an elaborate chart adorned with precise annotations and thorough diagrams, a comprehensive exploration unfolded concerning these six fundamental elements: the merge, the surge, the scourge, the verge, the purge, and the splurge. Buterin stressed the roadmap’s stability:

As Ethereum’s technical path forward continues to solidify, there are relatively few changes.

One of the crucial aspects of Ethereum’s blockchain technology is the “Merge,” which plays a central role in maintaining a streamlined and robust proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus. This significant development was accomplished in September 2022 by merging the ETH mainnet with a proof-of-stake blockchain, the Beacon Chain. The successful implementation of Merge has led to an amalgamation of two distinct blockchains, resulting in an efficient and secure network that can meet the demands of modern business and academic settings.

Ethereum’s Transformation: PoW to PoS And SSF Advancements

Following the completion of the merger, Ethereum underwent a significant transformation, transitioning from a power-intensive proof-of-work (PoW) consensus mechanism to a proof-of-stake (PoS) protocol, substantially reducing the network’s energy consumption. This shift to PoS is noteworthy as it has enabled ETH to operate more efficiently while reducing its carbon footprint.

Furthermore, Buterin explained Ethereum’s progress in single-slot finality (SSF). This important aspect guarantees irreversible blockchain block changes without staking at least 33% of the total ETH.

The role of single slot finality (SSF) in post-Merge PoS improvement is solidifying. It's becoming clear that SSF is the easiest path to resolving a lot of the Ethereum PoS design's current weaknesses.



See:https://t.co/l8OcVsXCOWhttps://t.co/8sM6DieMjg pic.twitter.com/i6Gz36huW4 — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) December 30, 2023

Addressing ETH’s original vision, Buterin revisited its inception as a “public decentralized, shared hard drive,” focusing on peer-to-peer messaging and decentralized file storage. He acknowledged a shift away from this vision in 2017 toward the financialization of Ethereum.

Notably, Buterin underscored the rise in prominence of rollups, zero-knowledge proofs, account abstraction, and second-generation privacy solutions, aligning with certain values tied to cypherpunk principles, denoting individuals who prioritize encryption for network privacy, especially against government entities.

The implementation and evolution of the outlined components have generated significant interest and anticipation within the ETH community. These innovative developments are expected to transform the platform, and stakeholders eagerly anticipate their practical implementation.

title: Exploring Kevin Sekniqi's 2024 Roadmap for Avalanche's Evolution - CryptoGlobe
content:
Kevin Sekniqi is a notable figure in the blockchain and cryptocurrency industry, recognized for his contributions as a co-founder and key executive at Ava Labs. Ava Labs is the company behind Avalanche, a blockchain platform known for its high throughput, low latency, and scalability, making it a popular choice for decentralized applications (dApps) and custom blockchain networks.

Kevin Sekniqi’s role at Ava Labs involves leading various aspects of the company’s strategy and operations, focusing on the development and growth of the Avalanche ecosystem. His work includes overseeing technological advancements, fostering partnerships, and promoting the adoption of Avalanche among developers and businesses.

Sekniqi, along with other co-founders of Ava Labs, including Emin Gün Sirer, a well-known computer scientist and professor at Cornell University, has been instrumental in driving innovation in the blockchain space. Their work at Ava Labs is particularly significant in addressing some of the common challenges faced by blockchain networks, such as scalability, speed, and interoperability.

In response to Ethereum inventor Vitalik Buterin’s recent publication of a technical roadmap diagram for Ethereum for 2024, Kevin Sekniqi of Ava Labs shared his personal wishlist for Avalanche’s development in the coming year. This wishlist, while reflective of Sekniqi’s personal aspirations, aligns with many developments already slated for Avalanche in 2024.

Here’s a detailed breakdown of Sekniqi’s wishlist

Base Layer Consensus Improvements

Sekniqi envisions significant enhancements in Avalanche’s base layer consensus. The goal is to reduce the time to finality to under 250 milliseconds, with an “optimistic fast finality” mode achievable in just one or two rounds. This improvement, deeply integrated with all APIs, aims to provide nearly instantaneous experiences for users, enhancing wallet and frontend interactions.

Consensus Capacity Upgrades

Proposed changes to the c-chain involve a swap to a non-primary subnet, accompanied by increased hardware requirements. Despite Avalanche’s lightweight nature, boosting storage and network bandwidth requirements could significantly enhance its capacity.

Deep Code Refactoring

A major overhaul in the codebase is planned, focusing on reducing technical debt. This involves removing all Geth code, except for the basic state transition logic, to reduce dependency on the Geth codebase. Such refactoring will simplify and secure code upgrades, accelerating VM upgrades.

Database Upgrades

Post-refactoring, Sekniqi suggests introducing FirewoodDB, a linear-access database optimized for blockchain data storage. This upgrade is expected to drastically improve the read-write efficiency of the EVM (and other VMs), addressing the current issue where validators spend a majority of their processing time accessing state data on disk.

Subnet Upgrades

The wishlist includes enabling c-chain-native elastic subnet staking. Currently, launching a permissionless, elastic chain is limited to tokens minted on the x/p-chains. Expanding this capability to the c-chain, where most active tokens currently reside, could be a significant development.

AWM and Teleporter

Sekniqi aims to bring AWM (Avalanche Wallet Messaging) and Teleporter (the messaging/bridging and contract interfaces) to production level. The objective is to achieve a time-to-finality for an AWM message between two subnets under one second, potentially making Avalanche the fastest network for chain-to-chain state transitions.

HyperSDK Development

HyperSDK, already facilitating easy subnet launches, is set for further enhancements. The goal is to evolve HyperSDK into a comprehensive toolkit that allows for easy modifications and upgrades to various chain components, fostering rapid experimentation.

Push for New VMs

Finally, Sekniqi expresses a desire to see HyperVM, Avalanche’s native VM, gain traction. He believes that HyperVM can enable optimizations beyond the capabilities of the current c-chain, potentially revolutionizing Avalanche’s performance and capabilities.

I don't have a visual diagram for the Avalanche tech roadmap, but here's an abridged summary of what I'd personally love to see, written in human-readable format. Note: this is my personal wish-list, but a lot of these are already slated for 2024.

Featured Image via Pixabay

title: Vitalik Buterin Unveils Ambitious 2024 Ethereum Roadmap - FXDailyReport.com
content:
Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has proposed an Ethereum roadmap for ecosystem development in 2024. Analysts expect Ethereum to reach $5,300. Ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market value, has become a complete ecosystem that supports decentralized apps and digital currencies.

Pal Targets $5,300 Using Liquidity Indicator

Real Vision co-founder and CEO Raoul Pal has also boosted Ethereum optimism. Pal anticipates Ethereum’s value to rise significantly in the first half of 2024 using the liquidity indicator, a measure experts use to predict price changes. Pal’s confidence matches the overall positive outlook for Ethereum, but such estimates are speculative.

Ethereum is anticipated to perform exceptionally well in the first half of 2024. Using the liquidity indicator, aim for $5,300. Ethereum may hit its peak in the first half of 2024, Pal said.

Pal noted that ETFs may affect Ethereum’s performance. He thinks a Bitcoin ETF might lead to an Ethereum ETF, reviving Ethereum.

The revised Vitalik Buterin approach for 2024 matches Pal’s bullish predictions. The co-founder highlighted many major improvements, including the addition of Single Slot Finality (SSF) to the post-Merge Proof-of-Stake (PoS) update. The SSF can fix Ethereum’s Proof of Stake (PoS) architecture, speeding up and improving transactional security.

Trending Now: SlowMist Exposes Unauthorized Approvals Leading to Crypto Thefts

Buterin stressed that SSF (Stateless Ethereum) is the easiest way to fix numerous Ethereum Proof of Stake (PoS) design flaws. EIP-4844 and rollup advancements have also helped engineers make breakthroughs in other sectors like the Surge. These enhancements will let Ethereum handle higher workloads and run more effectively, which are essential to its success.

Buterin Tackles Ethereum’s PoS Challenges with Scourge Redesign

Buterin’s approach addresses PoS economic centralization difficulties with the revised Scourge. The integrity and decentralization of the Ethereum network are the main goals of this overhaul, which addresses issues like Maximum Extractable Value (MEV) and stake pooling.

However, progress has been difficult. Current designs’ cryptographic flaws make Verifiable Delay Functions (VDFs) challenging for developers. Despite these challenges, the development team persists in studying and improving these services, demonstrating a strong dedication to the project’s long-term viability.

Vitalik Buterin’s broad strategy and analysts like Raoul Pal’s optimism support Ethereum’s path. Ethereum’s focused efforts to overcome technological difficulties and make improvements show a commitment to its development and originality, bolstering its position in the developing cryptocurrency market.

title: What Will Happen to Ethereum After Proto-Danksharding, Planned for 2024? - Crypto Economy
content:
As Ethereum continues to evolve, a key upgrade on the horizon is Proto-Danksharding. This improvement, also known as EIP-4844, is set to revolutionize Ethereum’s scalability and efficiency. Proto-Danksharding is an intermediate phase towards complete Danksharding. It introduces “blob-carrying transactions”, a new type of transaction that allows for more cost-effective data handling.

These blobs provide temporary storage for Layer 2 rollups, crucial for reducing operational costs. The introduction of Proto-Danksharding will significantly increase Ethereum’s transaction capacity while simultaneously reducing transaction costs. As the need for block space grows, transaction costs are becoming economically unsustainable for basic actions.

Proto-Danksharding aims to address this by decreasing gas prices and transaction fees. The implementation of Proto-Danksharding will also bring about a new fee mechanism for blob-data. This two-dimensional nature means that block builders will need to simultaneously avoid hitting two different limits (gas limit and data limit) when accepting transactions.

Moreover, Proto-Danksharding is expected to pave the way for full Danksharding. Full Danksharding is essentially a new kind of data availability layer. It is expected to result in a significant increase in block space and significantly reduce transaction costs, up to 10x less than current gas fees.

Ethereum’s End Users, the Primary Beneficiaries of EIP-4844

The enhancements suggested in EIP-4844 and the implementation of Proto-danksharding are primarily designed to benefit end users. The key outcome of these improvements is a substantial decrease in transaction expenses.

Lower fees also have the added advantage of enabling arbitrageurs to rectify minor price differences, which in turn draws more users to DEXs by making them more liquid and cost-effective to run. In the long run, enhancing the scalability of the Ethereum network encourages broader adoption, which is advantageous to all members of the ecosystem.

A part of the crypto community remains cautious regarding the impact of proto-danksharding on the price of ETH. A year after The Merge upgrade, Ethereum continue to trade at around the same price it did before the change took place. Others, however, are a bit more optimistic and claim the proto-danksharding upgrade will have an increasing impact on the price of ETH, going so far as to predict ETH reaching $4000.

In conclusion, the introduction of Proto-Danksharding is a game-changer for Ethereum. It promises to enhance scalability, reduce transaction costs, and prepare Ethereum for future advancements. As we look forward to its implementation next year, it’s clear that this upgrade will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of Ethereum.

title: Crypto Whale Transactions Signal Market Volatility: BTC And ETH Prices Under Pressure - TronWeekly
content:
In a recent development, Whale Alert, the renowned tracker of significant cryptocurrency movements, has reported substantial transactions involving Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) today. On December 30, a staggering 1,335 BTC was shifted from Coinbase to an undisclosed wallet, indicating a strategic move by a major player in the market. Simultaneously, a contrasting transaction saw 3,144 BTC sent to Coinbase, signaling opposing intentions within the whale community—one opting to hold and the other contemplating a sell-off.

Around $33.50 million worth of Ethereum was transferred to Coinbase, with an additional 9,991 ETH added within a few hours. This influx of ETH coincided with its recent surge in value, which pushed it beyond $2,400. Despite this rise, the altcoin faced difficulty breaking free from the $2,292 to $2,379 range, leading to speculation of a bullish trend until December 27th, followed by a consolidation phase.

Unveiling Crypto Whales’ Impact

The technical analysis highlighted a complex scenario for ETH. According to the Relative Strength Index (RSI), there was a clear indication of diminishing bullish momentum, suggesting a possible decline below the $2,300 mark if the prevailing trend continued. However, an interesting bullish divergence materialized within this context: while the RSI consistently formed higher lows, ETH’s price charted lower highs. This discrepancy hinted at an imminent reversal, potentially paving the way for a rally pushing ETH towards the $2,500 mark.

Source: TradingView

Meanwhile, Bitcoin’s recent price action contradicted the market’s optimism surrounding a potential ETF approval, with its value slipping below $42,000. The 4-hour chart revealed a bearish momentum signaled by the MACD, indicating a potential descent towards $40,000. However, a positive accumulation spike could trigger a bullish breakout targeting $45,000.

Source: TradingView

In the midst of these market fluctuations, the Accumulation/Distribution (A/D) indicator shed light on the stagnant accumulation of BTC in recent days. This prolonged lack of significant accumulation signals a potential downward trajectory for BTC if this trend persists, suggesting a probable downtrend in the near future.

Short-term projections indicate minor price adjustments for both ETH and BTC. Nonetheless, this doesn’t undermine the bullish prospects in the near term. Despite looming volatility, the market appears primed for potential reversals and upward movements in the forthcoming days, showcasing a resilient stance toward possible market shifts.
